displaytitle: Parable of the Blind Leading the Blind
dimensions:
plate: diam. 8.6 cm. (3 3/8 in.)
sheet: 9.5 x 9.4 cm (3 3/4 x 3 11/16 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Junius S. Morgan, Class of 1888
markings: In graphite, verso center: Coll. Six, Leipzig 1929, 400 Rks
inscribed:
Inscribed and dated in margin around: Deuia dum c[a]ecus ... lapsus vterq[ue] perit.  Anno 1586. 

Signed in plate, lower right: HG
catalograisonne: Bartsch 93-a-3; Dutuit 513; Hollstein 111; New Hollstein 16; Weigel 324

titles.title: Parable of the Blind Leading the Blind

makers.displaydate: 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands
makers.displaymaker: Hendrick Goltzius, 1558–1617; born Mülbracht, Netherlands; died Haarlem, Netherlands

texts.textentryhtml: Possibly Jan Six [1618-1700]. Possibly Rijksmuseum, Rijksprentenkabinet, Amsterdam; deaccessioned. Presumably sale in Leipzig, 1929; Junius S. Morgan [1867-1932]; bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum, 1932.

bibliography.boilertext: F.W.H. Hollstein, "Goltzius-Heemskerck," Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings, and woodcuts, ca. 1450-1700, (Amsterdam: M. Hertzberger, 1953).
bibliography.citation:
F.W.H. Hollstein, "Goltzius-Heemskerck," Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings, and woodcuts, ca. 1450-1700, (Amsterdam: M. Hertzberger, 1953).

, no. 111, p. 23

bibliography.boilertext: Otto Hirschmann and E. W. Moes, Hendrik Goltzius, Verzeichnis des graphischen Werks (Braunschweig: Klinkhardt & Biermann, 1976).
bibliography.citation: Otto Hirschmann and E. W. Moes, Hendrik Goltzius, Verzeichnis des graphischen Werks (Braunschweig: Klinkhardt & Biermann, 1976)., no. 111

bibliography.boilertext: Marjolein Leesberg, "Hendrick Goltzius," New Hollstein Dutch & Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts, 1450-1700 (Ouderkerk aan den Ijssel: Sound & Vision Publishers, in co-operation with the Rijksprentenkabinet, Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam, 2012).
bibliography.citation: Marjolein Leesberg, "Hendrick Goltzius," New Hollstein Dutch & Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts, 1450-1700 (Ouderkerk aan den Ijssel: Sound & Vision Publishers, in co-operation with the Rijksprentenkabinet, Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam, 2012)., no. 16, pp. 42–43 (illus.)
